messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Blackberries,
messages.msgSnippet: We have wayyyyyyy toooooo many to eat them all fresh!  We bring home 5 gallon buckets at a time. Lynda ... From: Mac and Carol Brown
messages.messageBody:
We have wayyyyyyy toooooo many to eat them all fresh! We bring home 5
gallon buckets at a time.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: "Mac and Carol Brown" <mjcmbrwn@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, February 02, 2001 3:54 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Blackberries,


> Gee, why don't you all just eat them fresh like we are? Actually, it's
> blueberries in our house at the moment. Oh, gosh, that's right - it's
winter
> over there isn't it <beg>
>
> Carol
> enjoying the fruits of summer in sunny New Zealand
>
>
> > << Shhhh, don't anyone tell Valerie about the bottom quarter of our
freezer
> > which is full of blackberries <g> The ones that didn't go into jam or
into
> > homemade yogurt and soft ice cream <<<BEWG>>>
> >
> > Lynda >>
> >
> > MMMMMMMMMMMM!!! I have a load of strawberries, picked fresh and frozen,
in
> > our freezer too. We've been dreaming about what to do with them, guess
our
> > first venture into jam making should be with them.
> >
> > Kris
>
>

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Blackberries,
messages.msgSnippet: Gee, why don t you all just eat them fresh like we are? Actually, it s blueberries in our house at the moment. Oh, gosh, that s right - it s winter over there
messages.messageBody:
Gee, why don't you all just eat them fresh like we are? Actually, it's
blueberries in our house at the moment. Oh, gosh, that's right - it's winter
over there isn't it <beg>

Carol
enjoying the fruits of summer in sunny New Zealand

***We'll be the ones laughing come August...

Valerie in stormy Tacoma WA

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Blackberries,
messages.msgSnippet: Gee, why don t you all just eat them fresh like we are? Actually, it s blueberries in our house at the moment. Oh, gosh, that s right - it s winter over there
messages.messageBody:
Gee, why don't you all just eat them fresh like we are? Actually, it's
blueberries in our house at the moment. Oh, gosh, that's right - it's winter
over there isn't it <beg>

Carol
enjoying the fruits of summer in sunny New Zealand


> << Shhhh, don't anyone tell Valerie about the bottom quarter of our freezer
> which is full of blackberries <g> The ones that didn't go into jam or into
> homemade yogurt and soft ice cream <<<BEWG>>>
>
> Lynda >>
>
> MMMMMMMMMMMM!!! I have a load of strawberries, picked fresh and frozen, in
> our freezer too. We've been dreaming about what to do with them, guess our
> first venture into jam making should be with them.
>
> Kris
